wines.description: A sophisticated Chilean red blend from the Cachapoal Valley, crafted from 64% Cabernet Sauvignon, 18% Merlot, and 18% Syrah. Each variety was meticulously aged in French oak barrels for 28 months, followed by 12 months of bottle aging, resulting in a wine of exceptional character and 15-year aging potential.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose opens with an exceptional bouquet full of fresh red fruit aromas, particularly ripe cherries and plums, interwoven with forest fruits and blackberries. Delicate floral notes of violets emerge alongside mineral aspects, creating a complex aromatic tapestry. Subtle hints of graphite add depth and sophistication to the overall aromatic profile.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, the wine reveals notable structure with soft, enveloping tannins that provide a luxurious mouthfeel. Well-balanced acidity supports the fruit core while allowing the wine's inherent elegance to shine through. The mid-palate shows concentrated dark fruit flavors accented by delicate notes of tobacco and warm baking spices, all harmoniously integrated from the extended oak maturation.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is impressively long and refined, with persistent notes of tobacco leaf and exotic spices lingering on the palate. The soft tannins continue to provide structure while maintaining elegance, leaving a lasting impression of both power and finesse that signals excellent aging potential.

servingInfo.decanting: Decant for 45-60 minutes to allow the complex aromatics to fully express and the tannins to soften further

wineDetails.ageability: Excellent aging potential of 15 years from vintage; drink now through 2035

wines.description: A vibrant coastal Chardonnay from Spanish Springs Vineyard in the San Luis Obispo Coast AVA, located just 1.5 miles from the Pacific Ocean. Made from clones 809, 17, and 96, this wine was fermented and aged for 9 months in 228L French oak barrels, producing only 537 cases and earning a 92+ rating from Jancisrobinson.com.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose presents enticing aromas of lemon curd and sea air with a hint of grapefruit and jasmine, creating a distinctly maritime character. Additional layers reveal bright gardenias, white peach, lime zest, and quince, complemented by subtle notes of green mango and wildflower honey. The aromatic profile perfectly captures the wine's cool-climate coastal origins.
tastingNotes.palate: Bright and stony flavors of lemon pith and lemon oil dominate the palate, enhanced by yellow herbs and a fresh nectarine attack. The mid-palate unfolds with juicy notes of apricot, grapefruit, kiwi, and tangerine, all supported by superb acidity that provides structure and refreshment. The rocky limestone terroir expresses itself through pronounced minerality and chalky texture.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish features delightful dryness with persistent lemon pith-and-peel notes and a slightly silky texture from the barrel aging. The maritime salinity and mineral edge linger pleasantly, providing a crisp, clean conclusion that invites another sip.

foodPairings: Grilled Pacific halibut with citrus beurre blanc
Fresh oysters on the half shell

servingInfo.decanting: No decanting necessary; serve directly from the bottle after proper chilling
servingInfo.glassware: White Burgundy or large white wine glass

wineDetails.region: San Luis Obispo Coast AVA, California
wineDetails.style: Coastal cool-climate Chardonnay with moderate oak influence
wineDetails.ageability: Best enjoyed within 3-5 years; drink 2021-2026 to preserve vibrant acidity and fresh fruit

wines.description: A vibrant expression of Oregon's Willamette Valley Pinot Noir from the small, family-run Les Brebis winery ("breu-BEE"), whose name references the Shaffer family's German heritage meaning "shepherd." Produced from sustainably farmed vineyards in the Eola-Amity Hills AVA and South Salem Hills, this wine is fermented in small lots with native yeast, aged in French oak barrels without chips, and bottled unfiltered without fining agents.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose opens with vibrant ripe red berry aromas, particularly dark cherry and cranberry, characteristic of premium Willamette Valley Pinot Noir. Subtle earthy undertones emerge, along with a touch of forest floor and delicate spice notes that speak to the organic and biodynamic farming practices. Light floral hints add elegance to the aromatic profile.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, everything you want from Willamette Pinot is present: juicy dark cherry flavors mingle with bright cranberry and hints of raspberry. A little spice from the oak aging adds complexity without overwhelming the pure fruit expression. The earthiness detected on the nose carries through, providing depth and terroir expression, while maintaining the characteristic silky texture of quality Oregon Pinot Noir.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is clean and persistent, with the red fruit flavors continuing alongside subtle earthy notes. The unfiltered, unfined bottling provides natural texture and authenticity, allowing the wine's true character to shine through the final moments.

foodPairings: Roasted duck breast with cherry reduction

servingInfo.decanting: Optional brief decanting of 15-20 minutes to aerate; native yeast fermentation benefits from air exposure

wineDetails.region: Willamette Valley (Eola-Amity Hills AVA and South Salem Hills), Oregon
wineDetails.style: Organic/Biodynamic Oregon Pinot Noir, native yeast fermentation

wines.description: A proprietary red blend from Pomar Junction Vineyard & Winery, crafted to highlight the unique El Pomar District of Paso Robles. This family-owned estate practices sustainable farming (SIP Certified) in vineyards blessed with distinctive limestone soils and cooling Templeton Gap breezes. The blend typically features 43% Merlot, 31% Cabernet Sauvignon, and 26% Syrah, though proportions may vary by vintage.

tastingNotes.aroma: The wine displays a brilliant, deep, rich color and opens with wonderful aromas of ripe plums and blueberries. Dark red roses add a floral complexity, while rich caramel notes suggest careful oak integration. The aromatic profile is immediately inviting and speaks to the wine's generous, approachable style.
tastingNotes.palate: Luscious berry flavors dominate the palate, showcasing the ripe fruit character of Paso Robles. Dark chocolate notes emerge mid-palate, adding depth and richness to the berry core. Warm baking spices from oak aging provide complexity without overwhelming the fruit, while the perfect amount of oak integration ensures balance and structure throughout.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is food-friendly and approachable, with the luscious berry and chocolate notes persisting alongside subtle spice. The limestone terroir contributes a mineral backbone that keeps the wine from being overly heavy, despite its generous fruit profile.

foodPairings: BBQ beef brisket with smoky sauce
Wood-fired pizza with sausage and peppers
Beef short ribs with red wine reduction

servingInfo.decanting: Decant for 30 minutes to allow the fruit and oak to fully integrate and express themselves

wines.productName: Chateau Josephine Cabernet Sauvignon Mevushal (MD & DC) 2023
wines.description: A kosher Cabernet Sauvignon from Yecla, Spain, where excellent weather and ideal soil characteristics allow grapes to achieve optimal ripening. This Mevushal wine has undergone flash-pasteurization to maintain kosher status even when handled by non-Jewish individuals, certified by OU, Rabbi Padwa, and Rabbi Ungar.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose presents classic Cabernet Sauvignon characteristics with ripe blackcurrant and dark cherry aromas. Spanish terroir influences appear through subtle Mediterranean herb notes and a touch of warm earth. The careful vinification preserves bright fruit aromatics despite the Mevushal process.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, the wine offers approachable dark fruit flavors with blackberry and plum taking center stage. The Yecla region's warm climate contributes to the wine's generous fruit ripeness, while maintaining enough structure for food pairing. Moderate tannins provide framework without excessive grip, making this an accessible everyday Cabernet.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with dark fruit flavors lingering alongside subtle earthy notes. The Mevushal process has been carefully executed to preserve the wine's natural character and drinkability.

servingInfo.decanting: Brief 15-20 minute decanting recommended to aerate
servingInfo.glassware: Standard Cabernet or large red wine glass

wines.description: A premium white wine from the historic Alella Vinícola cooperative, established in 1906 as one of Spain's first winemaking cooperatives. The iconic Marfil brand has captivated Barcelona and beyond since the 1920s, produced in a stunning modernist winery designed by Jeroni Martorell in 1906. This wine showcases the DO Alella region's signature grape, Pansa Blanca (known as Xarel·lo elsewhere).

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose reveals the classic aromatic profile of Pansa Blanca with bright citrus notes, white flowers, and subtle Mediterranean herbs. Stone fruit aromas of white peach and apricot emerge, complemented by a distinctive coastal minerality that speaks to the wine's proximity to the Mediterranean just north of Barcelona. Delicate hints of almond blossom add elegance.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, the wine displays vibrant acidity characteristic of DO Alella whites, with flavors of green apple, lemon zest, and white peach. The rocky limestone and granite soils of the region impart a pronounced mineral quality and saline edge. The mid-palate shows good weight and texture while maintaining freshness, a hallmark of quality Pansa Blanca.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is crisp and refreshing with persistent citrus and mineral notes. A subtle saline quality lingers, reminiscent of the nearby Mediterranean, while the wine's natural acidity provides a clean, mouth-watering conclusion that pairs beautifully with food.

foodPairings: Pan con tomate and jamón serrano

servingInfo.decanting: No decanting necessary; serve chilled directly from the bottle
servingInfo.glassware: Standard white wine glass or Spanish copa

wineDetails.grapeVariety: Primarily Pansa Blanca (Xarel·lo), potentially blended with other authorized DO Alella varieties
wineDetails.ageability: Best enjoyed within 2-3 years of release for optimal freshness

wines.productName: Vina Memorias Del Rambam Blanc (MD & DC)
wines.description: A kosher Mevushal white blend from Viña Memorias, a family winery located in the Protected Designation of Origin Utiel-Requena with privileged high-altitude terroir 70 km inland from Valencia. Named after Rabbi Moshe ben Maimon (the Rambam), this wine blends 80% Macabeo with 20% Sauvignon Blanc and is certified kosher by OU and Rabbi Padwa.

tastingNotes.aroma: The wine presents a straw yellow hue with light green golden reflections. The nose is rich with floral notes dominated by white blossoms and acacia. Bright citrus aromas of lemon and grapefruit emerge alongside tropical fruit notes of pineapple and passion fruit, the latter contributed by the Sauvignon Blanc component. The high-altitude terroir adds freshness and aromatic intensity.
tastingNotes.palate: Dry and crispy in the mouth, the wine showcases balanced acidity that highlights its pronounced minerality and vibrant fruity notes. The Macabeo provides body and stone fruit flavors of white peach, while the Sauvignon Blanc adds citrus zest and tropical brightness. The high-altitude vineyard location contributes to the wine's refreshing character and aromatic purity.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is clean and mineral-driven with persistent citrus and tropical fruit notes. The balanced acidity keeps the palate refreshed, while subtle floral echoes provide elegance. The wine's dry nature makes for a versatile food pairing companion.

foodPairings: Grilled white fish with lemon and herbs

wineDetails.style: Kosher Mevushal white blend, high-altitude expression
wineDetails.ageability: Best enjoyed within 2 years of release for optimal freshness

wines.productName: Bodegas Riojanas Vina Albina Gran Reserva 2017
wines.description: A prestigious Gran Reserva from Bodegas Riojanas, one of the historic houses that has written the history of Rioja with capital letters. Founded in 1890 in Cenicero by the Artacho family along with Rafael Carreras, this wine represents the culmination of traditional Rioja winemaking with 30 months in American oak barrels and a minimum of two years bottle aging before release. The 2017 vintage earned a Silver Medal at Rioja Masters and a 92/100 critics score.

tastingNotes.aroma: Elegant on the nose with well-blended aromas that showcase the harmony between extended oak aging and varietal character. Ruby-red fruit notes of cherry and raspberry mingle with hints of vanilla, coconut, and sweet tobacco from the American oak. Subtle leather, dried fig, and earthy undertones add complexity, while a touch of balsamic and forest floor speaks to the wine's maturity.
tastingNotes.palate: Very fine and well-structured in the mouth, the wine reveals the benefits of late harvest and slight over-ripening of the grapes. Good acidity provides backbone and freshness despite the wine's richness, while polished tannins offer structure without harshness. The blend of 80% Tempranillo, 15% Mazuela, and 5% Graciano creates layers of red fruit, spice, leather, and vanilla that are beautifully integrated and balanced.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is long and refined, with the polished tannins continuing to provide elegance. Notes of tobacco, vanilla, and dried red fruit persist, while the excellent balance between fruit, oak, and acidity ensures a harmonious conclusion. This is classic Rioja Gran Reserva at its finest.

foodPairings: Roasted lamb with rosemary and garlic
Wild mushroom risotto with truffle oil
Braised beef cheeks in red wine sauce
Serrano ham and cured Spanish meats

servingInfo.decanting: Decant for 45-60 minutes to allow this mature wine to fully express its complex aromatics

wineDetails.style: Traditional Rioja Gran Reserva with extended American oak aging
wineDetails.ageability: Excellent aging potential; drink now through 2032 or beyond

wines.description: A distinctive Sauvignon Blanc from Baleia Wines, established in 2009 by the Joubert family in South Africa's Southern Cape. Despite the Portuguese name meaning 'whale,' this wine hails from the Cape South Coast's rocky limestone soils in a remote and unspoilt corner. The labels are inspired by St. Sebastien Bay, known as the 'Whale Nursery of South Africa,' and the winemaking style draws inspiration from the region's Mediterranean climate.

tastingNotes.aroma: The wine displays a pale, greenish-gold color in the glass. Classic Sauvignon Blanc aromas dominate with elderberry flower and green fig leading the way. The rocky limestone soil imparts distinctive mineral notes, while the proximity to the Indian Ocean contributes subtle maritime nuances. Fresh-cut grass and hints of white pepper add aromatic complexity.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, crisp green litchi flavors are the hallmark, accompanied by gooseberry, passion fruit, and lime zest. The pure, solid limestone soil with very high mineral content creates a particular mouthfeel reminiscent of chalky minerality. Maritime salinity from the coastal location adds a unique dimension, providing both freshness and texture that distinguishes this wine from typical Sauvignon Blanc.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is vibrant and mineral-driven with the chalky limestone character persisting alongside green fruit and citrus notes. The saline edge from the ocean proximity lingers pleasantly, providing a refreshing conclusion that makes you immediately want another sip. The wine's purity and focus are impressive.

servingInfo.decanting: No decanting necessary; serve directly from the bottle
servingInfo.glassware: Sauvignon Blanc or standard white wine glass

wineDetails.style: Coastal limestone-driven Sauvignon Blanc with maritime influence
wineDetails.ageability: Best enjoyed within 2-3 years to preserve vibrant acidity and fresh aromatics; drink 2024-2027
